benchmark_details.name: MUIRBENCH (MULTI-IMAGE UNDERSTANDING BENCHMARK)
benchmark_details.overview: MUIRBENCH is a comprehensive benchmark designed to rigorously assess and evaluate multi-image understanding by multimodal LLMs. It consists of 11,264 images and 2,600 multiple-choice questions spanning across 12 distinctive multi-image understanding tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a robust evaluation on the multi-image understanding capabilities of multimodal LLMs and encourage the development of models that can effectively synthesize and reason across multiple visual sources.

data.source: MUIRBENCH has been created through existing dataset derivations and newly collected data.

methods: Evaluation on multimodal LLMs using various models
methodology.calculation: Evaluated through the performance of different multimodal LLMs on answerable and unanswerable instances.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better model performance in understanding multi-image relations.
methodology.baseline_results: Accuracy achieved by top models ranged from 49.3% to 68.0%.
methodology.validation: Evaluation against multiple recent multimodal LLMs
